alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman; Haywood; Madison; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Tipton, northeastern Fayette, northern Hardeman, southern Haywood and southwestern Madison Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Covington, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownsville, Bolivar, Whiteville, Hillville, Dancyville, Cloverport, Mercer, Mason, Stanton, Toone, Medon, Asbury, Yum Yum, Belmont, Hickory Point, Uptonville, Taylor Chapel, Shepp, Teague and Turnpike. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for western Tennessee. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for western Tennessee.
